Released: September 27, 2018

  
  
_**A Star Is Born**_ is the soundtrack album to the 2018 [musical film of the
same name](/wiki/A_Star_Is_Born_\(2018_film\) "A Star Is Born \(2018 film\)"),
performed by its stars [Lady Gaga](/wiki/Lady_Gaga "Lady Gaga") and [Bradley
Cooper](/wiki/Bradley_Cooper "Bradley Cooper"). It was released on October 5,
2018, by [Interscope Records](/wiki/Interscope_Records "Interscope
Records").[1] Gaga and Cooper collaborated on the soundtrack album with an
assortment of [country musicians](/wiki/Country_music "Country music"),
including [Lukas Nelson](/wiki/Lukas_Nelson "Lukas Nelson"), who also stars in
the film as a member of Cooper's band. For the more [pop](/wiki/Pop_music "Pop
music")-oriented songs on the soundtrack, Gaga teamed up with recurring
collaborator [DJ White Shadow](/wiki/DJ_White_Shadow "DJ White Shadow"). The
soundtrack also includes contributions from [Jason Isbell](/wiki/Jason_Isbell
"Jason Isbell"), [Mark Ronson](/wiki/Mark_Ronson "Mark Ronson"), [Diane
Warren](/wiki/Diane_Warren "Diane Warren"), and [Andrew
Wyatt](/wiki/Andrew_Wyatt "Andrew Wyatt") of [Miike Snow](/wiki/Miike_Snow
"Miike Snow"). Commercially, it has topped the charts in Australia, Canada,
the Czech Republic, Estonia, Ireland, New Zealand, Scotland, Slovakia, Sweden,
Switzerland, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

## Background and
development[[edit](/w/index.php?title=A_Star_Is_Born_\(2018_soundtrack\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Background and development")]

In March 2015, [Warner Bros.](/wiki/Warner_Bros. "Warner Bros.") announced
that [Bradley Cooper](/wiki/Bradley_Cooper "Bradley Cooper") was in talks to
make his directorial debut with [_A Star Is
Born_](/wiki/A_Star_Is_Born_\(2018_film\) "A Star Is Born \(2018 film\)"), the
fourth remake of the [1937 film of the same
name](/wiki/A_Star_Is_Born_\(1937_film\) "A Star Is Born \(1937 film\)").[2]
[Lady Gaga](/wiki/Lady_Gaga "Lady Gaga") was officially attached to the film
in August 2016, with the studio green-lighting the project to begin production
in early 2017.[3] Cooper plays Jackson Maine, "a veteran country singer who
discovers and eventually falls in love with a struggling singer-songwriter
named Ally, played by Gaga."[4] Gaga "helped inform Cooper's performance as a
musician".[5]

Cooper spent two-and-a-half years prepping for the film and determining what
kind of musician his character would be. He worked with a number of musicians
and vocal coach Roger Love.[6] Cooper said, "by the end he just kind of
started developing into his own sort of creation. If I had another year of
prep, it would have been complete rock, but now it's some sort of hybrid."[6]

## Writing and
recording[[edit](/w/index.php?title=A_Star_Is_Born_\(2018_soundtrack\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Writing and recording")]

Cooper described the soundtrack "an evolution, like the story."[7] Gaga and
Cooper were writing songs for the soundtrack during filming, leading to "so
many different incarnations of each song."[7] Cooper added that "the music
really became a character in the movie. There is no lyric that's ever in any
point of the movie that doesn't have exactly to do with where one of them is
or hopes to be or regrets being. That was our launching pad and then it was
just about discovering what songs fit in the right places."[7] [Jason
Isbell](/wiki/Jason_Isbell "Jason Isbell") wrote a song for Cooper's
character, which became "the sword with which a lot of the music spawned from
[Cooper]". Isbell sent the song through [Dave Cobb](/wiki/Dave_Cobb "Dave
Cobb"), a [Nashville](/wiki/Nashville "Nashville")-based producer with whom
Cooper had been collaborating.[8]

Cooper approached [Lukas Nelson](/wiki/Lukas_Nelson_%26_Promise_of_the_Real
"Lukas Nelson & Promise of the Real") (son of country music singer [Willie
Nelson](/wiki/Willie_Nelson "Willie Nelson")) after seeing him perform at
[Desert Trip](/wiki/Desert_Trip "Desert Trip") in October 2016 and asked him
to work on the film as a music consultant.[9] Nelson said he began "writing
songs for the movie, just for the heck of it, and sending them over to the
producer, and they started liking them. Then Lady Gaga came by and I met her
and we clicked. We became good friends, and we started writing together."[10]
Gaga, in turn, provided backing vocals on two tracks on Nelson's self-titled
album released in 2017.[11] Nelson and his band, Lukas Nelson & Promise of the
Real, appear in the film as Cooper's backing band.[6]

Gaga reunited with producer [Mark Ronson](/wiki/Mark_Ronson "Mark Ronson") and
songwriter [Hillary Lindsey](/wiki/Hillary_Lindsey "Hillary Lindsey"), who had
both contributed to her previous studio album _[Joanne](/wiki/Joanne_\(album\)
"Joanne \(album\)")_ (2016).[6] She worked with recurring collaborator [DJ
White Shadow](/wiki/DJ_White_Shadow "DJ White Shadow") on the soundtrack's
more pop-oriented numbers performed by her character Ally. Much of the album
was recorded live on set, at Gaga's insistence.[1][6]

## Music and
lyrics[[edit](/w/index.php?title=A_Star_Is_Born_\(2018_soundtrack\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Music and lyrics")]

_[Billboard](/wiki/Billboard_\(magazine\) "Billboard \(magazine\)")_ described
the soundtrack as "integral to the plotline", adding that "many of the lyrics
are about wanting and longing for change, but noting the struggle. Some
express the great love and beautiful bond the booze-addled rock star (Jackson
Maine, played by Cooper) and neophyte singer-songwriter (Ally, played by Lady
Gaga) have for each other", and concluding that "the music stands up, movie or
no movie. They are timeless, emotional, gritty and earnest. They sound like
songs written by artists who, quite frankly, are supremely messed up but hit
to the core of the listener."[12]

##
Release[[edit](/w/index.php?title=A_Star_Is_Born_\(2018_soundtrack\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Release")]

The soundtrack's track list and release date were announced on August 30,
2018.[4] [Interscope Records](/wiki/Interscope_Records "Interscope Records")
tweeted that the album "features 19 songs in a wide range of musical styles +
15 dialogue tracks that will take you on a journey that mirrors the experience
of seeing the film."[13] Its track
"[Shallow](/wiki/Shallow_\(Lady_Gaga_and_Bradley_Cooper_song\) "Shallow \(Lady
Gaga and Bradley Cooper song\)")" was released on September 27 as the album's
lead single.[14]

The soundtrack received positive response from critics. At
[Metacritic](/wiki/Metacritic "Metacritic"), which assigns a
[normalized](/wiki/Standard_score "Standard score") rating out of 100 to
reviews from mainstream publications, the album has an
[average](/wiki/Weighted_arithmetic_mean "Weighted arithmetic mean") score of
78, based on 8 reviews, indicating "generally favorable reviews".[15] In a
positive review, _[The Washington Post](/wiki/The_Washington_Post "The
Washington Post")_ called the soundtrack a "five-star marvel" and stated that
it is a possible contender to win a [Grammy Award](/wiki/Grammy_Award "Grammy
Award").[23] Ben Beaumont-Thomas of _[The Guardian](/wiki/The_Guardian "The
Guardian")_ gave the album a positive review, acknowledging "Bradley Cooper
shows he can sing as well as act and direct", but that "it is Lady Gaga’s pop
prowess that lifts each track, be it spectacular piano ballads or heart-
rending duets"[18]

In a positive review, [Stephen Thomas Erlewine](/wiki/Stephen_Thomas_Erlewine
"Stephen Thomas Erlewine"), writing for [AllMusic](/wiki/AllMusic "AllMusic"),
said "All the songs make sense narratively and on their own, so they hold
together well and would amount to a first-rate soundtrack", but criticized the
dialogue included in the album.[16] _[Rolling
Stone](/wiki/Rolling_Stone_\(magazine\) "Rolling Stone \(magazine\)")_ 's
Brittany Spanos gave the soundtrack four stars out of a possible five, saying
"The music Gaga helps write for this stretch in Ally’s career...is gorgeous--
romantic without being trite and powerful."[21] Nick Reilly of
_[NME](/wiki/NME "NME")_ complimented the album's "emotionally charged songs
that feel entirely appropriate for this heartfelt tale of doomed romance",
adding that the album is "one of the best Hollywood soundtracks of recent
years."[19]

Writing for _[The Daily Telegraph](/wiki/The_Daily_Telegraph "The Daily
Telegraph")_ , [Neil McCormick](/wiki/Neil_McCormick "Neil McCormick") gave
the album a moderately positive review, saying the soundtrack was enjoyable,
but criticized the "slightly awkward journey from rock balladry to slickly
superficial pop" and stated that "there is also a weird disconnect as the
soundtrack shifts gear to anodyne modern pop".[17] Jeremy Winograd of _[Slant
Magazine](/wiki/Slant_Magazine "Slant Magazine")_ , in a mixed review, was
critical of the album, saying "There’s undoubtedly a strong 10-song album
lodged at the core of A Star Is Born, but unlike the film, wherein an outsized
sense of sentimentality is rendered affecting by the more grounded
performances, there’s not nearly enough substance here to justify all the
bombast."[22]

## Commercial
performance[[edit](/w/index.php?title=A_Star_Is_Born_\(2018_soundtrack\)&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Commercial performance")]

_A Star Is Born_ opened atop the US [_Billboard_ 200](/wiki/Billboard_200
"Billboard 200") with 231,000 [album-equivalent units](/wiki/Album-
equivalent_unit "Album-equivalent unit"), including 162,000 pure album sales.
It had the biggest overall sales week for a soundtrack in over three years,
and is Gaga's fifth US number-one album as well as Cooper's first. Gaga
extended her record as the female artist with the most chart-topping albums
during the 2010s, breaking her tie with [Taylor Swift](/wiki/Taylor_Swift
"Taylor Swift"). Beside its pure album sales, _A Star Is Born_ earned 37,000
in stream-equivalent units and 32,000 from track-equivalent units.[24] The
soundtrack spent a second week at number one there with 143,000 album-
equivalent units (86,000 being pure sales), and became Gaga's second album to
top the chart for two consecutive weeks after _[Born This
Way](/wiki/Born_This_Way_\(album\) "Born This Way \(album\)")_ (2011).[25] It
then held the country's summit for a third week in a row with 109,000
equivalent units (61,000 pure sales), becoming the first soundtrack since
_[High School Musical 2](/wiki/High_School_Musical_2_\(soundtrack\) "High
School Musical 2 \(soundtrack\)")_ in 2007 to top the chart for its first
three weeks. Additionally it became Gaga's longest running chart-topping album
in the country.[26]

_A Star Is Born_ entered at number one on the [Canadian Albums
Chart](/wiki/Canadian_Albums_Chart "Canadian Albums Chart"), selling 18,000
equivalent units, earning the top sales and digital song download honors and
the seventh highest on-demand streams for the week. The soundtrack was Gaga's
third album to reach the summit in the nation and her first since _Born This
Way_.[27] The soundtrack held the top position for the next week, with another
12,000 equivalent units and was also the top-selling album.[28] It had an 11%
increase in sales during the third week and remained atop the charts, selling
close to 14,000 equivalent units. Like in the United States, the soundtrack
became Gaga's longest running chart-topping album in Canada for Gaga.[29]

In the United Kingdom, _A Star Is Born_ faced competition from [Twenty One
Pilots](/wiki/Twenty_One_Pilots "Twenty One Pilots")' fifth studio album,
_[Trench](/wiki/Trench_\(album\) "Trench \(album\)")_ , with the midweek chart
suggesting the latter to emerge as the top album. _A Star Is Born_ pulled
ahead at the last moment according to Alan Jones from _[Music
Week](/wiki/Music_Week "Music Week")_ , and debuted atop the [UK Albums
Chart](/wiki/UK_Albums_Chart "UK Albums Chart") with 31,816 units (including
6,178 from stream-equivalent units). It became Gaga's fourth album to reach
number one in the nation and first since _[Artpop](/wiki/Artpop "Artpop")_
(2013), as well as Cooper's first entry on the chart.[30][31] The soundtrack
was then displaced by [Jess Glynne](/wiki/Jess_Glynne "Jess Glynne")'s
_[Always In Between](/wiki/Always_In_Between "Always In Between")_ the
following week, and it fell to number two, selling 24,732 equivalent
units.[32][33] For the week ending November 1, 2018, the soundtrack moved back
atop the chart with 24,982 copies sold (including 6,645 from sales-equivalent
streams). "Shallow" also reached the top of the [UK Singles
Chart](/wiki/UK_Singles_Chart "UK Singles Chart") that week, making Gaga and
Cooper score an [Official UK Chart
double](/wiki/List_of_artists_who_have_achieved_simultaneous_number-
one_UK_Single_and_Album "List of artists who have achieved simultaneous
number-one UK Single and Album"), this being Gaga's third time to do
so.[34][35]

_A Star Is Born_ opened at number one in Ireland and Scotland,[36][37] and was
Gaga's third number one in the former.[38] During its third week atop the
Irish chart, the soundtrack attained its highest sales tally.[39] In France,
the soundtrack sold 8,700 units and debuted at number seven on the [SNEP
Albums Chart](/wiki/SNEP "SNEP"), and held the same position the next week
with another 8,000 units.[40][41] In Australia, _A Star Is Born_ entered at
number three on the [ARIA Albums Chart](/wiki/ARIA_Charts "ARIA Charts"),
giving Gaga her seventh top 10 album in the country and her sixth to reach the
top three.[42] Two weeks later, the soundtrack reached the top of the charts,
becoming Gaga's third album to reach the Australian charts summit after _The
Fame Monster_ and _Born This Way_.[43] The soundtrack debuted at number six in
the [New Zealand Albums Chart](/wiki/Recorded_Music_NZ "Recorded Music NZ"),
and after two weeks reached the top.[44]
